meanings.definition: To make a sudden forward movement.
meanings.sent1: The cat was lunging at the toy mouse.
meanings.sent2: She was lunging forward to catch the ball.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel lunging for the acorn looked quite determined.
meanings.sent4: The car lunging ahead in traffic startled the other drivers.
meanings.sent5: The athlete was lunging towards the finish line with all his might.

meanings.sent1: The sudden lunging of the horse scared the rider.
meanings.sent2: His lunging towards the door surprised everyone in the room.
meanings.sent3: The penguin's lunging for the fish was quite comical to watch.
meanings.sent4: The lunging of the waves against the shore was relentless.
meanings.sent5: The lion's lunging at its prey was a sight to behold in the wild.
